title: Will the Nats once again help usher in an era of Tory government?
text:
Scottish Nationalists should tread extremely carefully whenever the words "Tories" and "general elections" are mentioned in the same breath for the simple reason that "there be dragons".

Forty years ago it was the then SNP group of MPs in the Commons whose deliberate actions prompted a no-confidence motion in the James Callaghan Labour government, which was won by one vote by the Conservatives, thanks to the votes of those nationalist MPs.

It was an incredible spectacle for those, like me, who witnessed it, given that it, in turn, led to a general election and 18 years of Tory rule, 11 of them led by none other than Margaret Thatcher.

It was a legacy that the SNP has long tried to live down but...
description: Scottish Nationalists should tread extremely carefully whenever the words "Tories" and "general elections" are mentioned in the same breath for the simple reason that "there be dragons".
